turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Little raven.
turn.1: What did you find most interesting about the Little raven?
turn.2: Little raven The little raven ("Corvus mellori") is a species of the family Corvidae that is native to southeastern Australia.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: An adult individual is about in length, with completely black plumage, beak, and legs; as with all Australian species of "Corvus", the black feathers have a grey base, and the iris of the adult bird is white (typical also of some related species from islands to the north of Australia).
turn.6: Although the little raven was first named by Gregory Mathews in 1912, it was only in 1967 that there was consensus to separate it from the Australian raven ("C. coronoides") as a distinct species.
turn.8: In the 1960s, the CSIRO were intensively studying Australian raven populations and their relationship to lambing and sheep in southeastern Australia.
turn.9: What did they do when they studied it?
turn.10: It became evident that there was a smaller species of raven living alongside the Australian raven.
turn.11: What were some of the differences?
turn.12: These birds lived in smaller trees, had smaller throat hackles and lacked the bare skin of their larger relative.
